alert.note: Alert for Florence; Forest; Langlade; Menominee; Northern Marinette County; Northern Oconto County; Oneida; Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 12 at 4:12AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER EXPECTED DURING THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK... A slow moving low pressure system will bring periods of wintry precipitation beginning late Tuesday night and continuing at times through Thursday. A mix of snow, sleet and freezing rain will arrive from southwest to northeast late Tuesday night or Wednesday morning. It will gradually change to all snow by late Wednesday afternoon, and continue into Thursday. Several inches of snow accumulations are likely, with some totals over 6 inches over far northeast Wisconsin possible. A tenth of an inch of ice is also possible before the precipitation changes to all snow. Travel will likely become hazardous by Wednesday morning. There is still some uncertainty about the storm track and precipitation amounts, so listen for later forecasts.
